item.title: 'No ball games' signage removed, 11th June
item.description:
Last year (July 2024) Greenwich Council installed 'No ball games' signs along the boundary with Sunbury Street Playground and the Kerslake Mews estate. This was due to a request from residents after damage to private property (double glazing units needed to be replaced, damage to fences and gardens), and tresspassing where youths climbed into residents' gardens. The installation of the signage by Greenwich Council recognised that ball sports are not the activity for which Sunbury Street Playground was designed for (active play for under 12s) per its own Parks Byelaws. However, this signage was inadequate, being just A4 pieces of paper stapled to the fences, and was subsequently ripped down. Balls are now being kicked against fences again, causing damage and grief to local residents. Please can adequate signage be installed, such as a powder-coated metal signs, all the way along the boundary with the Kerslake Mews estate and Sunbury Street Playground. We feel this would resolve the issues once and for all and provide peace to residents in their own homes. This has been raised as a separate request via telephone, reference number PEOS - 989215 if you need more information. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sunbury Street, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 11th June
item.description:
I would like to report a car that appears to be abandoned in our area. The vehicle has been left in the same spot for several months, and is only moved briefly—approximately once every 4 months, more —before being left again for an extended period. This pattern has been ongoing for some time, and the vehicle is not in regular use. It is taking up valuable parking space and gives the impression of neglect. Please investigate whether it meets the criteria for an abandoned vehicle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harmony Place, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langley Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small fire in Whitehall Recreation, 11th June
item.description:
I was woken at just after 04.30 this morning by people shouting at one another in the park. Shortly after that I noticed smoke coming from near the hedge line. Thankfully it was put out or extinguished itself fairly quickly, however, I am very concerned about this due to the fact that we are experiencing drier weather (luckily we have had quite heavy rain over the last week). I walked over to site this morning and could still feel heat where the fire was. The garden of my house backs directly onto the park and has the hedge line as a backdrop (which I love and certainly would not wish for it to be removed) but my real concern is the potential for something like this getting out of hand…

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southlands Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
